ai.summary: Haltlands – Finnigarth – Northdale is a 7 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom that links the areas of Haltlands, Finnigarth and Northdale. The route offers a varied landscape with woodland trails, grassy sections and gentle elevation changes, suitable for hikers with some experience seeking a steady day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of shaded forest paths, open moorland, and grassy tracks. Footing can be uneven with exposed roots and occasional rocky or slippery sections, especially after rain. Some stretches may be soft underfoot and waterlogged after rain; waterproof footwear recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly. Bring waterproofs and extra layers, and be prepared for wind or rain. Wear sturdy boots and watch for roots and uneven ground. Stay on marked paths, carry a map and compass or GPS, and inform someone of your plan. Daylight is variable by season; start early in autumn/winter and carry a light source and a small emergency kit.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing including a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are ideal for this route in the UK, with caution and weather checks during changeable months; winter hiking is possible but more challenging.

seo.title: Haltlands – Finnigarth – Northdale: 7km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Haltlands, Finnigarth and Northdale on a 7 km moderate UK hike. Terrain includes woodlands and moorland with practical safety tips and gear recommendations.
